sentence.Network_en: She seemed to personify goodness and nobility.
sentence.Network_cn: 她宛如善良和高贵的化身。

sentence.Network_en: These children personify all that is wrong with the education system.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些儿童充分体现了教育制度的缺陷。

sentence.Network_en: Artists personify beauty in their works.
sentence.Network_cn: 艺术家在作品中表现美.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...他诗日后呈证。“[2]3作品赏析《秋天，这秋天》一诗最值得注意的是，林徽因也效仿济慈一样，把“秋天“拟人化（personify），但是，济慈让“秋天“变成了“你“（thou），而林徽因让“秋天“变成了“他“。林徽因在这首诗中的“.

list.abs: he is kindness personified .他是善良的化身.
Justice is often personified as a blindfolded woman holding pair of scales ., 常把蒙著眼睛手持天平的女人当作正义的象徵.
she is chastity personified .她是贞节的化身。

natural beauty is the result of personified nature and the art of landscape painting and poem is the subjective materialized form of natural beauty through the sensation of personal experience .自然美是人化自然的结果，山水诗画艺术是主体自然美感经验的物化形态。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from French personnifier, from personne 'person'

entry.tran: 是…的典范；集中体现；象征
entry.def: If you say that someone personifies a particular thing or quality, you mean that they seem to be a perfect example of that thing, or to have that quality to a very large degree.

example.ex: She seemed to personify goodness and nobility...
example.tran: 她宛如善良和高贵的化身。

example.ex: ...the world of inter-war decency as personified by Stanley Baldwin...
example.tran: 在斯坦利·鲍德温身上所体现的两次大战间体面正派的人生

means.word_mean: 1. invest with or as with a body; give body to
2. represent, as of a character on stage;

auth_sentence.content: They personify the paralympic motto of "spirit in motion".

auth_sentence.content: They represent the spirit of an age and personify the minds and hearts of the people who inhabit them.

means.word_mean: 将(某事物)人格化、拟人化

sentences.en: We often personify the sun and the moon, calling the sun “he” and the moon “she”.
sentences.cn: 我们经常用“他”来称呼太阳, 用“她”来称呼月亮, 使他们人格化。

means.word_mean: 以人的形象表现(思想、品质等);象征

sentences.en: Artists personify beauty in their works.
sentences.cn: 艺术家在作品中表现美。
